items.title: AI Can Help Limit the Spread of Misinformation During Natural Disaster, Study Finds
items.description: By the third day after the levees broke in August 2005, misinformation in New Orleans about lawlessness and looting was rampant. It became so pervasive that many recovery efforts following Hurricane Katrina’s landfall were halted or delayed. In 2018, a wave of wildfires in California sparked its own misinformation surge. items.title: Human-Caused Global Warming Spiked the Death Toll of Europe’s Early Summer Heatwave
items.description: Human-caused global warming increased the peak temperatures of an early summer heatwave across much of Europe by up to 7 degrees Fahrenheit and tripled the number of expected heat deaths in 12 European cities, an international team of scientists reported Tuesday during an online press conference. items.description: The Trump administration—ignoring decades of climate science and downward economic trends—has begun the process of reopening millions of acres of public land to coal mining in the Powder River Basin, the nation’s largest coal deposit.
